intro: Odontonema latifolium, commonly known as broadleaf odontonema, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and showy, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, and thrives in humid, tropical climates. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, are often used in ornamental gardening due to their striking appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
